But scrapping NAFTA would be killing the proverbial goose that has laid the golden egg.
I urge us as a society - instead of criticizing free trade - to consider how we can better address each of these unique challenges that come along with free trade.
Because of the great good accomplished by free international trade, I’m concerned about some of the rhetoric I hear coming out of Washington D.C. these days that is critical of free trade.

Free trade - based upon fair rules of exchange - means greater economic opportunity, and a higher standard of living and less strife.

International trade can and should be a win-win for everyone. #utpol https://t.co/cAr5vPRNyM

@Kolkena Thank you for your question.

@Kolkena Much of the 1.35 million acres of the original Bears Ears Monument are under Wilderness Study Area protections already. There are similar protections throughout much of Grand Staircase as well. WSA status prohibits both development and mining, among other activities.

@danransomphoto @SutherlandInst @RepJohnCurtis Existing law has protected these lands, but there has been insufficient enforcement. These resource protection units are important because they represent a practical, dedicated enforcement of existing law.

@JudithKohler There are many already existing protections on these federal lands that prohibit looting and aim to protect archaeological sites. Additional funding for the BLM will allow enforcement to protect these sites. That's a practical solution we can all agree on.

@SoJoGuy As explained in this video, H.R. 4532 would preclude any mining or drilling within the 1.35 million acres of the original Bears Ears Monument. We want to protect them for generations -- and keep them public.

@Kolkena Good question, Alex. There's a common misconception that the state is trying to claim these areas as state lands. In fact, these are federal lands and will remain so -- the state can't claim them.
@JudithKohler Let's talk about what we're doing now. We're working to increase education and enforcement of existing laws that prohibit looting in these beautiful areas.
